Campus Involvement: ShireiNu, Alpha Chi Omega, Boxing club
Comments: No effort was put into this app, answers felt like they could be applied to any university with an a cappella group and a large student body.

Campus Involvement: Sailing team, Norris PSV Star Command, Nine Lives, TriDelt
Comments: I definitely got a sense of the applicant's voice, though I do wish there was a video component to this app. The written portion seemed a bit repetitive at times.

Campus Involvement: Tennis team, Phi Psi, Sports Night, Sportsman Club
Comments: No effort in the application, no originality, looks like applicant didn't read the first question right.

Campus Involvement: Zeta, lab, Student Health Advisory Committee
Comments: Applicant was very appropriate, though some of the answers ran long and were a little unfocused (made me lose track of what I was reading). They appear very, very passionate about NU, though.

Campus Involvement: Lacrosse, SPAC work study, SWE
Comments: I had a difficult time with this app--the response to the second question lessons learned made me uncomfortable, and it didn't look like the student learned anything other than "check your biases," which she didn't elaborate on in the first place. Other than that, answers were generally unfocused.
Reasons for Concern: There's a video link but the video is unavailable.

Campus Involvement: Norris cashier's office, lab
Comments: Quite middle-of-the-road application, nothing really stood out to me
Majors: Human Communication Sciences, Psychology, Kaplan Humanities scholar

Campus Involvement: work study, student theater, Willard social chair
Comments: This applicant gave me something new, I really enjoyed reading about aspects of campus I didn't know about. Very refreshing.

Campus Involvement: MUN, Camp Kesem, Alpha Chi Omega
Comments: I think I saw a semblance of their voice in the app, but I'm definitely interested in seeing them during an interview.

Campus Involvement: Delt, running club
Comments: This applicant comes off really kind. There's definitely room for improvement on the campus awareness aspect, but I'd be interested in seeing them in person to validate the high appropriateness/thoroughness scores.

Campus Involvement: Chi O, Happiness club, DM
Comments: This applicant's experiences will be relevant to many prospective students. Super appropriate, focused answers that did not go on for longer than they should.

Campus Involvement: Blackout, Studio 22, PA, Brady Campaign Chapter
Comments: Application ran a little long, and there were a couple sentences that didn't convey meaning (i.e. were unfinished). Overall good messages to hear on a tour, but applicant only spoke of their involvement in film. Would like to see more.

Campus Involvement: Blackout, NNN, sorority
Comments: I was very torn by this application. The candidate obviously bleeds purple, but their answers are not grounded to experiences as much as enthusiasm, and I'm not sure the tangents they went on were the most appropriate.

Campus Involvement: Daily NU business office, Spectrum theater, ShireiNU a cappella, Essence tap, GPhi
Comments: Great applicant with focused responses and a great voice. Super involved and appropriate.

Campus Involvement: NU sports analytics group, Club golf, SigChi
Comments: An OK application, the candidate didn't really go in depth in their answers and must've misunderstood the slogan question.

Campus Involvement: Phonathon, Willard exec, Hearts for the Homeless, ukulele club
Comments: The application started off really strong, but the slogan response was weak. Also they wrote about some bad press about NU/focused on other universities being better with branding and didn't really provide a spin.
Reasons for Concern: "Though if NU has a scandal come out, it might be a bad slogan." "

Campus Involvement: Work study, sailing team, MUN, PA, sorority
Comments: Honestly, the application made me laugh. This applicant has a clear, lovely voice, but I'd love more concise, targeted answers in a couple questions.
Majors: Social policy, Economics, Segal design certificate

Campus Involvement: Volleyball, NU Younglife, College Mentors for America
Comments: Answers were a little short, I'd personally like to see more of this applicant if they're invited for an interview.

Campus Involvement: NBN, Reformed University fellowship, squash
Comments: This journalist knows their stuff, remains super appropriate throughout the app and has the most passionate, thorough and original application I've read so far.

Campus Involvement: NUCHR, Al-Bayan magazine
Comments: Application was very generic and short.
Reasons for Concern: "Everyone is cheerful and helpful which was a major change from my previous school where the slogan was 'Where Fun Goes to Die.'"

Campus Involvement: lab, SigChi
Comments: The first two responses were strong, but the latter two felt a little short and repetitive. The applicant knows their way around a lab, but seemingly not much else. I'd wait a year.

Campus Involvement: Camp Kesem, Evans Scholars, Lurie's Children's Hospital
Comments: Very honest (but not oversharing) application. I really got a clear, engaging voice from the candidate.

Campus Involvement: lab, DG, Spoon
Comments: Very original application with focused responses and passionate writing. The candidate is very thoughtful.

Campus Involvement: Wildside, APhi
Comments: The application, other than the first response, was not specific enough to Northwestern. Even for the 'day in the life of a NU member' question, the candidate didn't specify which NU athlete they'd pick, making the response sound generic.

Campus Involvement: Work study, DM, DZ, Women in Law, Hillel
Comments: While this applicant clearly put a lot of effort into their responses, the lesson and slogan answers are a bit unfocused and unprofessional (e.g. they go on to discuss a friend's "dangerous eating disorder"). Can be taught in training though.

Campus Involvement: Supplies for Dreams, NBN, L&M, CRC exec, DM
Comments: Short, generic application.

Campus Involvement: Camp Kesem, Delt, IM sports
Comments: I wanted to like this candidate, but they didn't give me a lot in this application. Answers felt thoughtful on their part but read very unfocused in the end.

Campus Involvement: Powder Blue Media, frisbee
Comments: This candidate's a business bro that doesn't seem to do much outside the Garage, but I'd want them to come in for an interview.

Campus Involvement: AEPi, theater
Comments: Quite middle-of-the-road app, another pre-med student talking about overcoming genchem. Their response to the 'fly on the wall' question though was very thoughtful and I got a sense of their storytelling skills there.

Campus Involvement: Best Buddies, real estate club
Comments: I might suggest we wait a year for this applicant to gain more experiences, but their responses hint at an engaging voice.

Campus Involvement: NU Nights, NU Real Food, lab
Comments: Answers are only a couple sentences long.

Campus Involvement: ZTA, global arts marketing, Scene + Heard, The Daily NU, DM
Comments: I'm interested to see this applicant in an interview.
Majors: Dual degree Comm studies and Jazz studies, IMC

Campus Involvement: cheerleading
Comments: Maybe wait a year, the application was quite generic and the one longer/more thorough answer (lesson) did not focus so much on NU as the candidate's relationship with their mom

Campus Involvement: SigNU, KASA
Comments: The candidate did not tie Northwestern to their responses as well as they could (the answer to the first prompt was not even about NU), and did not go in depth into their responses.

Campus Involvement: Mayfest
Comments: This applicant is not involved in much outside of classes, but I'd love to hear how they approach the interview questions. The responses were not as detailed as they could be, but I did get a hint of their engaging voice.

Campus Involvement: SigChi, IM sports
Comments: Specific, detailed responses and a lot of purple pride, though I'd like some more range in the aspects of their lives they detailed.

Campus Involvement: DG, Fusion, ISBE, China Care
Comments: This application made me lol with the coolest lesson. This candidate has an engaging, yet kind, voice that I'm interested in hearing more of.

Campus Involvement: SWE, GPhi, CSA
Comments: This applicant focuses most of their answers on engineering/McCormick, but I can definitely see them being a knowledgeable junior with many experiences to share.

Campus Involvement: MeeOw, ODB, Titanic, Vertigo
Comments: Funny but short

Campus Involvement: ASG, Emerge Leadership Program, Northwestern Art Review, Sexual Health and Assault Peer Education, Brady Scholars Program
Comments: First application without NU in the slogan! However, it was super original. Only the second response was a little weak and unfocused, but I'm excited to see this candidate in the interviews.
Majors: Art History, PoliSci, Classics, Brady Scholars Program

Campus Involvement: Lipstick, The Daily, Blackout
Comments: Very interesting transfer app. I really enjoyed their perspective throughout the responses, and their purple passion and voice are very visible and clear.

Campus Involvement: ISBE, Delta Sigma, knitting club, NUDM, AAIV, Women in Business
Comments: Loved this applicant!! Super different from everything I've read so far (they went into memes and the power of religion all within the same app) and, despite being just a first-year, they know a lot about campus already. I'm sold.

Campus Involvement: Besy Buddies, AKPsi, ISBE
Comments: When I pasted the link of the video, Vimeo said the page does not exist. Other than that, the applicant had a really strong response to the first prompt, and while the rest were a little unoriginal, I found a lot of pride and enthusiasm in them being a Wildcat.

Campus Involvement: lab, work study, Northwestern Business Review, ASG
Comments: I like this candidate's voice a lot (first-gen, low-income), but the application was at times not specific enough and all over the place. They appear to have a knack for storytelling, though.

Campus Involvement: Delta Sigma Pi, Investment Management Group, DZ, DM, SPAC lifeguard
Comments: I really liked this applicant; they were very appropriate all throughout, and they were the first one for me to really break stereotypes surrounding NU. They'd definitely be able to handle tough questions from parents.

Campus Involvement: Chapin, Applause for a Cause
Comments: The application was definitely thorough, but I didn't see a lot of originality in the responses. I would've loved to see NU through their eyes in the slogan question, but they just repeated "And is in our DNA," which they said felt like a cop-out but supported it.

Campus Involvement: Farley, barista, German Undergrad Advisory Board
Comments: I enjoyed the "lessons learned" response, but I didn't think this was a strong application for a junior. There didn't seem to be much campus awareness, and the storytelling aspect of the "life as a member of the NU community" prompt was lacking.
Majors: LOC/Middle East and North African Studies/International Studies

Campus Involvement: Marching Band, basketball, SAI, University Christian Ministry, Flipside
Comments: This applicant is very involved and their responses are very kind and wholesome. I think the messages they'd send out to students would be lovely, I'm just a little afraid about a couple "prestigious school stereotypes" they brought up in the app that I thought needed a better spin.
Majors: Is transferring to WCAS for neuroscience and polisci

Campus Involvement: Kappa, AKPsi, Girls in Engineering, Best Buddies, Her Campus
Comments:
Best. Slogan. Ever. Super original app with a clear, passionate voice. I'm just a little hesitant on giving a higher appropriateness score due to the response to the second prompt, where the applicant didn't really break the stereotype of comparing themselves to others, but rather what came off was "everyone is too different, why try."

After watching the video, my verdict is WE MUST HIRE HER.

Campus Involvement: F15, PCP, Mayfest, Blackout, Niteskool, Camp Kesem, STUCO, film sets, ZBT
Comments: I scored this applicant low on appropriateness because they did not convince me on their spin for transferring to NU (in fact, they only said the "LOVED" Syracuse twice) and their slogan was a little inappropriate. The app did make me chuckle a couple of times, but they also misread the last question, which means they might not have paid that much attention to the prompt for us to see their storytelling instincts.
